review_title: Unbelievably terrible and unsafe working environment
years_at_company: Unbelievably terrible and unsafe working environment
pros: Able to perform an unique job with no one breathing down your back. Other than that, not even worth one star.
cons: This company provides NO support for the employees that actually provide the services and actually MAKE the money! The is little to no corporate contact and when there is contact, it is extremely negative and degrading. Women are treated with less regard than men. Corporate has absolutely no idea what happens in their company. They provide unsafe vehicles and unsafe and out of date equipment, which puts the patient's safety in jeopardy. They go out of their way to make your job more difficult. When vehicles are deemed unsafe to drive, they put a bandage on it and consider it fixed. This is also how they run their company!
advice_to_mgmt: There is no fixing this company! They will never understand that having happy employees is not a bad thing!

review_title: Travel the state, meet old people, and irradiate them
years_at_company: Travel the state, meet old people, and irradiate them
pros: It's generally not a difficult job. There are no unusual stresses. If you like to drive, then it's great. The pay is reasonable. It's definitely better than working in a hospital. You get paid for travel back to your home on days you keep the X-Ray van.
cons: When you interview, you'll be told something like, "We try to get you out on time, but every now and then you'll have to work over." This is a fairytale. Getting out on time is more the exception than the rule. Say your shift is over at 6:00pm- the dispatchers excel at consistently sending you to jobs where you'll arrive onsite at 5:58pm to shoot a 30 min exam. Then you may have to drive over an hour to get home - no consideration is given in sending you to an area anywhere near where you live. Sure, you're getting paid on the drive home, but there reaches a point where your ability to see your spouse and kids more than 15 minutes a working day becomes more important than overtime.
advice_to_mgmt: Plan ahead so that your staff levels match the workload. Quit trying to do more work with less people. All that does is run off good employees, which definitely exacerbates your problems.

pros: They have a Management Team that cares for the employees
cons: Going through acquisitions currently, lots to do

pros: You gain experience by learning from your co-workers (who are willing to teach you) and from your own mistakes.
cons: Gee well where do I start? If I could give this place 0 stars I totally would. I'm almost positive that the review that was posted on 12/20/2016 was from a manager or team lead because no one in their right mind actually working there now would say that. I worked there for a year and it is the most incestuous place you will ever work. Managers bring in their un-qualified, un-experienced, lazy family members to "work" and all they do is sit around and talk, and wait for other people to do their work for them. The organization of this place is close to ZERO, they have no policies and procedures. Management just walks around with an agenda in their hands, and they have "meetings" in which you can hear their laughter all around the 5th floor. They demand that you do overtime, and if you don't, then you run a pretty high chance of getting written up for "insubordination". Management and Team Leads do not give recommendations FOR ANY REASON, it almost seems like a requirement for them to be promoted. So it is almost impossible to get out of there to find a better job. Thank God that I did.
advice_to_mgmt: BE HUMAN, don't treat the workers like slaves or working animals. STOP THREATENING TO FIRE THEM just because people have a life outside of work and they have children to take care of. Mark Schryver, pay attention to the people that are making it possible for you to sit in your office on the 6th floor and do NOTHING all day long!

pros: Family Atmosphere, Good co-workers, lots of opportunity
cons: Growing too quickly, its easy to get lost in the shuffle

pros: Overtime and pay , independent working
cons: Management horrible , very unprofessional , company complaints

pros: I loved my co-workers in most departments, they were the only reason I stayed as long as I did. The pay was okay, benefits were okay as well.
cons:
New company buyout which means a lot of people were done wrong. Females do not get the same recognition or promotions as men. Hours worked for amount of pay-not good. High stress and very little positive feedback.

Miss the old company-this last year was the worst year this lab has ever seen.

Corporate is greedy and does not care about a single employee. This was the most unorganized buyout I have ever been through.
advice_to_mgmt:
Corporate has no clue what the long term employees brought to this company. Bad decision to bring corporate people in to take over, but we know it was just to clean house with the good, higher paid employees.

Management needs to get a clue because the turn over is higher than ever and rising by the day.

pros:
-Flexibility - Get out of the hospitals 4 walls. While this is a driving intensive job, it's nice to be out and around town.
-independence - This job allows you to spend a lot of time alone. Personally this is one of the biggest appeals for me. I like my space. But in the same token help is just a phone call away.
-Variety - Sure a chest X-Ray is a chest X-Ray and that isn't going to change. But when you get to walk into a completely different room with different set up/ layout and equipment every exam can become different. Not to mention getting to interact with staff from multiple facilities (good and bad thing). But for the most part this is pretty awesome. Some facilities are friendlier than others, but i routinely have nurses inviting me to participate in snacks and pot lucks.
-Skills - Thinking outside of the box is key in this job. When you are completely off detent you have to get good at seeing the bigger picture. Being able to see angles and setting manual techniques are I think the biggest takeaways from this job. Working around patients instead of having them conform to an X-Ray room.
-Hours - In a time where company's are moving everyone to part-time, so far we still seem to have a surplus of hours. We have scheduled hours as well as on call hours. Plenty off opportunities to round out paychecks.
-Management - I appreciate having a supervisor's who has done my job. I think this really helps.
cons:
-Equipment - Biggest complaint I have about the company/ job is that the equipment is not really taken care of. I feel as though the company should be replacing cassettes/ IP more often. I mean this is a mobile job so things get banged around. But i still feel the current system should be evaluated. Vehicles are old. They get serviced regularly, but it seems like the company waits to the last minute to replace them.
-Hours - On call is nice for hours, but some months I wish it is optional. But this is pretty standard with everywhere I've worked. Also depending on what shift you work it's possible to have to stay past your shift to finish up. Usually balances out but is annoying when you aren't expecting it. Though if you really do need to be off leadership will generally let you go.
advice_to_mgmt: As always... what company couldn't do with more employee investment. Doing things like paying for licensing fees would be amazing. But generally i am pretty satisfied with my job, so keep it up.

pros: The company is incredibly flexible, the local management team is stellar and are supportive of the operations, being a mom & pop company still shows through the corporate structure. They value their employees and are constantly working to keep moral high and appreciate employees. I would highly recommend this company!
cons: I don't have any cons that I can think of, there are high demands sometimes but they take care of you and compensate for it.
advice_to_mgmt: Never Stop Never Stopping

pros: The only thing I think I liked about this company was the option to work 4 ten hour shifts, at least I had 3 days off from the worst place I have ever worked.
cons: Nobody cares about fixing broken processes. Very young, inexperience people working there who were completely unprofessional. This is the worst work environment I have ever experienced. Co-workers were extremely rude and didn't care about proper training. You are also extremely overworked and underpaid.
advice_to_mgmt: Quit letting inexperienced kids be in charge. Look at practical solutions to problems instead of letting them build up to the point that it can't be fixed.

pros: great company to work for

pros: Work independently, very nice boss. Friendly co-workers.

pros: You get to work outside of an office but most importantly, you get to make a difference with the elderly men and women who are just looking for a some respect and value to make their day.
cons: The management. All they really care about is the bottom dollar and how to expand the business while neglecting home base. They false advertisement their equipment especially the xray equipment in Denver. The vehicles they make you drive is unsafe, dirty and unhealthy. This company is the epitome of why health care is so bad these days. Hardly any patient care or interaction because they want you to move on to the next dollar. They pay is not competitive at all. You are forced to drive in harsh conditions at times or else you will not be paid. Management is hard to get a hold of and they don't communicate directly to you. Upper management like to communicate with other managers who work less but try to keep busy by micromanaging every detail. Upper management constantly puts the wrong people into lower management positions because it's easier to dictate what they want accomplished without a fight. In other words, your manager is most likely a yes man and will not have your back. Those managers who have your back in this company will most likely leave or be fired. Good luck to those who apply to work for this company. Its not a bad first job but if you want to make a difference you too will leave with a bad taste in your mouth.
advice_to_mgmt: Communicate and get in touch with your money makers which are your employees who do the hard work out in the field and not those sitting behind the desk.

pros: Ability to get full time hours quick

pros:
I am a MA, so I am used to working a typical 8am-5pm job at a doctors office. I absolutely LOVE the shift that I work 6am-2pm. The day goes by so fast. Between the driving to each destination, and interacting with the patients in their home the day FLY'S by.

Pays gas mileage.

Awesome/FUN co-workers.

I've been here only a few weeks . Upon reading most of the bad reviews on here, I can KIND of see what these employees are talking about. However I can't say that I have experienced any of what I read.

The only con I can think of is the rude patients you sometimes encounter. But in the healthcare field that is to be expected.

Nepotism is this entire company; drama, no coaching or support; poor communication and lack of leadership direction at all levels. Low quality leadership produces low quality workers at all levels. review_title: UNDERPAID, POOR ORGANIZATION, NO COMMUNICATION, LOW STANDARDS FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE NEW HIRES
years_at_company: UNDERPAID, POOR ORGANIZATION, NO COMMUNICATION, LOW STANDARDS FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE NEW HIRES
pros: Lots of overtime, non-traditional schedules available, and double time pay if you work on the holidays.
cons: Poor training, unrealistic expectations, little to no quality standards for hiring given the type of industry, managers are either never around or do nothing to improve processes and procedures, customer relations department supervisor is over-worked and given roles outside of managing his department. Employee concerns are not acted upon, pay is less than poverty level standards. Will hire almost anyone and then don't understand why clients dissolve their contracts due to poor customer service. No on-going training to identify issues mis-information when employees communicate with clients. No concept of an organizational structure that fits a successful service model and company goals. No communication of consistent information - everyone does things differently. VERY TOXIC & DRAMATIC WORKING ENVIRONMENT. Medical service company that does NOT offer employees short-term disability wage replacement unless you opt into a supplemental plan that you use pay for and only receive 60% of your sub-covertly level wages - no matter how much OT you work for them.
advice_to_mgmt: Read all of the above and hire intelligent, capable individuals that have a work ethic that exists beyond just a paycheck. When your front-line employees, who interact directly with your customers everyday, are well-spoken, intelligent, capable, individuals who can problem solve, communicate effectively, and generate solutions THIS WILL RESULTS IN LONG-TERM CONTRACT RETENTION. No matter how great everyone on the upper levels of the company hierarchy might be - if your customer service representatives are of low quality and cannot pay rent based - you will continue to lose contracts and lots of $$$. One quality, well-paid employee can do the job of 5 low quality, under-paid employees. Pretty simple - you could actually pay less in labor expenses and make more money, while retaining employees and clients long-term, while also reducing the costs associated with employee turnover. By the way...I am an entry level employee and I just addressed and solved ALL of the major organizational issues. You're welcome.

review_title: Keep looking as this is not a good place to work
years_at_company: Keep looking as this is not a good place to work
pros: None that I saw in my tenure there
cons: Hostile work environment. Management and CEO have the latest equipment while other office and mobile staff have old, unreliable equipment. Nepotism is rampant and if you are not part of the clique they will fire you and hire their own. Management "leaks" things to the staff. Benefits are expensive with little or no employer contribution. No real holidays at this company. No work / life balance except for management and upper management. Everyone else is treated badly. Hostile work environment. Back stabbing co-workers.
advice_to_mgmt: None, as it seems that this is the environment that they have deliberately created in their quest for the almighty dollar.

pros: They offer Medical and dental insurance- very expensive ,however.
cons:
I have worked here at the Denver lab for quit a few years. I am desperately attempting to educate my self so that I can seek employment somewhere else. The people that work here are extremely unprofessional. I work in the lab as a tech. Schryver is so cheap they are not willing to pay a Medical Technologist to perform in supervisor positions. I have witnessed them promote other MLT's to act as supervisors in some of their other labs in other states. I have never worked in another lab that allowed completely un-trained, unqualified, un-licensed employees to release patient results and run complex lab instrumentation.

Schryver must employ an amazing legal team to get away with what they do. I do not know how they pass any of their lab inspections.

QA who have no concept of lab instrumentation insist that techs release results from samples that have been collected improperly or are questionable just for the sake of putting out a completed result. No regard for the validity of results, they just want to get paid from the facility.
All of this is know by the lab supervisor who insists that we report out these results. As an MLT, the lab supervisor knows that ethically THIS IS NOT ACCEPTABLE, but goes along with this practice. Grounds for dismissal at any other lab.

Management insists that techs occasionally release results remotely from the Denver lab for testing performed at other labs from Phoenix and Seattle! If you work here and have a professional license, you are risking your future and your career.

I am constantly getting my hours cut. There is no real sense of well-being here. This is definitely not a good long-term employer to consider. I am currently attempting to obtain my ASCP medical technologist licensure so I can leave this place behind.

I could go on forever about how ridiculous this place is, but by now you get the gist of it.
advice_to_mgmt: Do not hire a non experienced MLT to be in charge of Chem,heme,coag and micro.

pros: Some of the people are great too work with.
cons: Increase in work load, but no incentive or pay increase to show your appreciated.

Wow where can i start! Much to many too list here. All I can say is this company has very poor judgement on who they select to make important decisions. They keep the people who they like and do not base judgement on facts. I for instance was the hardest working person in customer relations. I ran my department and helped cover other departments. And instead of recognizing my hard work they made false claims and got …

pros: I got nothing, I picked one star because 0 was not a option

This company cares only for the dollar!! They just let go of so many good hard working experaniced employees it is just pitiful. Of course they said "your position has been eliminated" due to us loosing business but they just moved other people in that position. They only employees they care for are part of the nepotism that
runs wild in this company. They discriminate. The supervisors gossip and tell every other employee your business. They play favorites and have no problem reprimanding in front of other employees.

pros: The only pro there is is that you can listen to your own music all day long and still get paid. There is no other nice thing that can be said about this poorly run company.
cons: The people, the management, the total lack of ability of the employees being able to communicate in English, the back-stabbing - by co-workers as well as management, the threats made by management, the lack of stable work hours, the lack of ability to move up the company ladder. Lastly, this company is so incestuous you feel dirty just walking in the door.
advice_to_mgmt: Walk down to the 5th floor and actually talk to the people who are doing the daily grind and actually working 40+ hours a week. See what is going on since the managers have no clue at all! In addition, instead of giving bogus typing tests - since you are going to hire the applicant no matter the outcome, give the applicant a test regarding whether or not they can comprehend English when it is spoken to them and can speak it and can read it as well. There are less than a handful of employees who can do all three!

pros: Love traveling from facility to facility. My supervisor is very reasonable and cares for his staff. Love my co workers. I am very happy here
cons: My only true complaint is driving in severe winter weather. The highway could be closed, yet we are still expected to drive.
advice_to_mgmt: Stronger communication would benefit all employees. Less opportunity for confusion. When on call and juggling a full board of Stats from one end of the city to the other while being the only phlebotomist for the shift, a text will come in for an eta. Reading and answering said text only hinders the amount of time you have to do the Stat. If driving, this involves stopping or exiting the highway to address the text. Time consuming. I also see it as a safety issue. If dispatch or accessioning knows you are the only phlebotomist, that you have a full board, you have greenroads and must drive slowly, and it may be snowing, you may be in traffic, you may have a very hard patient to get the blood from etc...All the eta inquiry does is slow you down. Common sense

pros: Competitive pay, great benefits, and the company is growing rapidly offering tons of opportunities for advancement. Hard work does not go unrecognized and the company is very fair. Management is beginning to make cultural changes and are recruiting higher caliber employees to join us. You get the benefits and stability of a large company with the entrepreneurial feel of a startup. We have potlucks and management brings in pizza and sandwich for us. I love it here.
cons: The non-management staff that has been there for a long time has a strong sense of entitlement (which can be seen in some of these more uninformed reviews) and is not open to change -- even when the changes are new, state-of-the-art systems and processes changes that make everyone's lives easier.
advice_to_mgmt: Stay the course.

pros: This company is geared toward younger people, and offers decent benefits. When I started a year ago, it was a family atmosphere. There was a good team in place and the Phoenix office ran like a well-oiled machine.
cons: As time went on, though, things seemed to take a negative turn. After a new team lead was put in place, people began leaving. Staff issues taken to office management went by the wayside, with the staff members being told the issues were their own issues. Office management seemed to turn a blind eye to most of what was occurring, specifically, favoritism and bringing on untrained personnel.
advice_to_mgmt: Consider the staff that does keep the company functioning...the field personnel. Perhaps some respect from management to the line staff might make them want to stay on.

review_title: Worst job I've had!! If someone offered me a million dollars to go back, I WOULD NOT!!
years_at_company: Worst job I've had!! If someone offered me a million dollars to go back, I WOULD NOT!!
pros: They give you their own car to drive. Except I barely fit in the car and you have "green roads", which was not fun to drive with.
cons: I've had plenty of jobs in my life and this one by far was the worst. I worked there for almost a year and right before I left was one of the longest people working there, the location I was at was new and so many people left. I wish I could have left sooner. I worked every weekend for about 5 months and was treated terribly by my lead who was making the schedule, she gave newer people better schedules! She thought she was the queen, her "friends" she had, got great treatment and did whatever they wanted for quite some time. Also I had one woman here who harassed me constantly, I told my Lead and told the branch manager but nothing was ever done about it. She still talked down to me and said some really unprofessional inappropriate things that would get her fired anywhere else. She got away with treating even new people terribly. While she was training them telling them they are slow and shouldn't be at this job. Way to go! Scare more people off why don't you...trust me they will be happier. Also near the last month or two of working here I figured out that the men were making a lot more money, hourly, than the women (heard from a few guys I worked with, who were shocked how little I made), and the management lied saying we were all making the same and couldn't afford to give us a slight raise by the end of the year. This should not be happening in this day and time but it still is. I was furious when I found all this out! It's illegal! I know other companies that are similar are making over 10 dollars more than this place. Also if you want to work 10-14 hours every single night this is the place for you. If it's not don't even try. They are so understaffed and expect everyone to move like lightening, and drive 50 miles north and then 70 miles south in traffic and plus a car you can't drive a little over the speed limit in because of "green roads". And you are dealing with some patients who have dementia and make things take a while at nursing homes, and going to extra nursing homes because there isn't enough staff....yet still expect you to NOT get any overtime! ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? It just made me so mad and stressed out while at this job. I don't know how they are still in business or how anyone could enjoy working here. Management was so negative about so much. I never will come back to this job. They do not care about their staff! The last straw I had was the 3rd shoot out in the area. I was probably a minute away from being right in the middle of it. When I told my Lead I was scared and didn't want to drive in Oakland at night anymore. She told me to suck it up, this is the job! Are you serious?? Yeah...I feared for my life yet they didn't care.
advice_to_mgmt: Fire a lot of leads and management. They gossip about everyone, act unprofessional and are lazy, and you are letting them get away with it. Fire the people who get away with a bad job, yet they criticize the people who actually do their jobs and make up for what the lazies didn't do before!

review_title: This place will drive you to drink.
years_at_company: This place will drive you to drink.
pros: What used to be pros when I started have become Cons. I can think of no reason I would want to work here.
cons:
Not given resources to do job required
Unrealistic deadlines for minimal staff
Too busy chasing a profit to care about quality staff
Retaliation by management when issues
 are mentioned
Very low rate of pay for industry
They do whatever it takes to get rid of you once you no longer fit their agenda
Management and sales set the expectations without even knowing if the current staff can successfully adapt
advice_to_mgmt:
First and foremost, you get what you pay for. Hiring new graduates because they are cheap and then expecting them to perform at the same level as someone with 10+ years of experience is ridiculous.
Learn to take constructive criticism. Learning what The business is doing wrong is a prime opportunity to improve.
Involve all employees in various decision making tasks. Remember it is the employees who will have to do whatever it is that is decided upon.
Stop treating employees like they are expendable. One of the biggest wastes of money is hiring someone, training them and then deciding to get rid of them because they said something you didn't agree with or you decide you don't like them. And stop hiring warm bodies just to fill a position! Be selective and make sure the person fits the job.
Evaluate your spending a little more closely. Spending money to train facilities to use the computer system the company spent a lot of money on and then not requiring facilities to use that system and expecting internal departments to compensate is not the definition of cost
effective.
Management needs to stop reacting to issues with emotion. Listen to the issue and provide guidance to resolve it.
They talk about career advancement opportunities but there are very limited examples of people who have advanced.

review_title: Get ready to work A LOT!
years_at_company: Get ready to work A LOT!
pros: They hired me on the spot
cons: They were dishonest about the hours I would be working. I was told 2-10pm. More like 2pm-2am. Even though they pay overtime, it is really a 60 hr a week job. Too much for me.

pros: Growth, great field/industry, and competitive in it's market. Potential for great jobs security.
cons: Business model needs great improvements. Benefits are lacking and incentives are childish. I wonder if the CEO is really directing and running Schryver Medical anymore.
advice_to_mgmt: The idea of this organization is stellar in my opinion. Also in my opinion, a move to halt growth and an intense investment in structure, direction and mission, will leverage a stable growth environment. I do not think that balancing the two is an option, unless there is an ability to invest in large amounts of outside consulting. I believe that this organization, which deals with medical billing (direct and insurance), must be flexibly. My opinion is that such a an organization that requires frequent changes, must have sound project management.

review_title: It is very difficult to work with management in this organization.
years_at_company: It is very difficult to work with management in this organization.
pros: The co-workers! We worked together as a team to make sure the job was completed.
cons: The biggest challenge is management. They were difficult to work with at times.
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to the people that actually do the job. Work together to streamline workflow and schedules.

pros: There is nothing positive about this company
cons: This place can be summed up in one word: Drama. Just about everyone here will stab you in the back. People are more concerned with rumors than work, even supervisors. A higher ranking employee at one time was even fired for sexual harassment and for whatever reason brought back and is again sexually harassing people. They are committing some serious crimes with all the verbal, sexual and physical harassment. If you have a problem don't expect to have it solved, management will witness it and walk right by ignoring it. I'm treated horribly but expected to come in on my days off and they, with a veil over it, threaten me. They never approve days off and pay is so low it's insulting. The only way people gain advancement is to be nasty, brown-nose and throw people under the bus; the people who actually work hard and play by the rules always end up taking the all the gruff for the people who can't seem to mind their own business and they are all the same people who have been there for years- and management is well aware of them but just doesn't care.
advice_to_mgmt: This place has not hope. They only way I can see this place ever succeeding is to hire an outside company to do an assessment so there is a non bias party evaluating the higher ups and the rest of management. in my opinion, if this happened, they would clean house and everyone would be gone.

pros: freedom, benefits good people not a hard job

advice_to_mgmt: incentives to work harder

review_title: Great company, felt like a family.
years_at_company: Great company, felt like a family.
pros: Pay was great. Gave me the opportunity to see a lot of Washington State. Always had someone to reach out to in case of emergencies. Provided vehicle, gas card etc. When we had issues with our vehicle or machine we had someone to call and a solution was handed down immediately!!! Management was open and UP FRONT and HONEST. Which is SUCH a rare quality in todays world!! I loved this job!
cons: Lock downs while we were in a prison taking images.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work!

review_title: Working here is pretty much tramatizing...
years_at_company: Working here is pretty much tramatizing...
pros: None that I can think of.
cons: They completely overload the employees and always ask ppl to work over due to being understaffed but then chastize you for the hours they begged you to come in overtime. Their actions make it 100% clear that they don't appreciate their employees (cars always have issues like brakes going out and tires blowing out.The pay is the lowest I ever heard of for phlebotomy) tacotime supervisors make significantly more
advice_to_mgmt: If you want the best employees, you need to appreciate your employees that are going above and beyond. Investing in your employees is investing in yourself. Also keep better communications, treat your clients better and take pride in your bussiness not just the money it is making you.

pros: Small environment set to grow. The owner is approachable and seems to be a reasonable family man just trying to run his business.
cons: Uncoordinated, young, executive team. Zero leadership or accountability across the company. Rife with finger pointing and unprofessional behavior. It feels more like a high school environment then it does a professional corporation. Inefficient processes and bad customer service is resulting in a loss of business. Fear of retribution leaves employees with no outlet to try and establish change. Middle and upper management appear to be lying to the owner about the state of affairs in the company. Poor screening of new employees and nepotism without accountability results in a fairly incompetent work force. Compensation isn't competitive with little to no increases. Extremely expensive benefits.
advice_to_mgmt: Top down leadership defining the direction of the company to all middle management. Middle and executive management should be held accountable for developing a professional environment, not a school yard gathering. Increase salaries or decrease cost of benefits, they are about five times more expensive then most.

pros: Able to help grow company to new levels
